channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2025040006
item.description:
Report E-2025040006

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Clean Harbors personnel arrived onsite and observed an estimated two hundred seventy-five (275) gallons were released from a two hundred seventy-five (275) gallon IBC plastic tote. It affected 100’-by-20’ area of concrete and a 3’-by-3’ area of trailer floor. It was damaged in the mechanical shop then placed on the trailer. Clean Harbors advised the mechanical shop that it needed pressure washed and flushed down the oil water separator. Granular absorbents were deployed to the affected areas. Clean Harbors then transferred seventy-five (75) gallons of remaining product into a new IBC plastic tote. It was then determined there were two hundred (200) gallons released. The generated waste was four (4) 55-gallon metal drums containing impacted absorbents and one (1) 85-gallon metal drum containing absorbents and cut up tote. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal. The ESTES terminal supervisor approved all work before Hepaco departed.

item.title: Report E-2025040002
item.description:
Report E-2025040002

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-28
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Ultrasil 110 was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean the trailer floor. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal can which was damaged on the top chime causing a release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025040001
item.description:
Report E-2025040001

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 27, 2025, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN1477 were punctured and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the site. The crew utilized cleaners, absorbents, and hand tools to clear the impacted floor. All impacted materials and the damaged bags were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025031544
item.description:
Report X-2025031544

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-21
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/21/2025 at approximately 1200 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 164671 at the ramp facility in Newark, reporting a chloroform spill. The shipment consisted of 8 glass bottles packaged in a fiberboard box, one of which broke during transit. The cause of the damage is unknown. The shipment did not appear to have sufficient cushioning or inner slots for proper packaging, in accordance with IATA Section 5. The package is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2025031540
item.description:
Report X-2025031540

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/19/2025 at approximately 1300 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a presumed gasoline spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained about 4 glass bottles of liquid. The shipment was discovered where liquid had completely absorbed into the outer packaging and emitted a gasoline odor. Further investigation revealed one broken bottle and a saturated safety data sheet "crude oil" inside of the box for; however, the odor from the shipment indicates otherwise. The shipment displayed an Excepted Quantities mark, but the amount of liquid in each inner contents appears to exceed the limits shown in IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held. pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025030196
item.description:
Report E-2025030196

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1200
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/12/2025, at 12:29 hours, FRA Inspector David Robinson, reported at the CSX Moncrief Yard in Jacksonville, Florida the GATX 205634, a loaded tank car of Flammable Liquid, N.O.S (Turpentine) was leaking from the vapor line valve. The car was isolated and the shipper, International Paper Co, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025031200135). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapor line valve partially open and secondary closure plug less than tool tight. Contractor personnel closed the vapor line valve and properly tool tighten the secondary closure plug. Contractor personnel also corrected 1 of 6 manway swing bolts less than tool tight that was identified by the FRA inspector. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Marceia Cox (901-229-4591).

item.title: Report X-2025040001
item.description:
Report X-2025040001

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-29
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared hazmat found during screening. Other undeclared hazmat found with no release as follows. (Replicating questions 14-29) Lithium ion batteries//haz class 9// UN 3480//not shipped as hazardous waste//not toxic by inhalation//not shipped under Exemption, Approval, or CA number//shipment was undeclared with no release//packaging type non-bulk/outer packaging plastic box// I was screening using the x-ray and saw ammos on the shipment. Did physical search as secondary screening and confirmed its ammo
